Michal Fasanek

Technical Mind / Creative Spirit / Swiss Knife

I’m an explorer. I don’t get bored easily but I do need a job where I’ll be able to learn new things. I'm motivated by developing new and existing skills, and am looking for a position that will challenge me.

I like data. And I need context. I can absorb a lot of information and I rarely get overwhelmed. I perform at my best when presented with the ‘big picture’ and when confronted with meaningful tasks. Open communication is everything.

I believe that fun belongs to work. I understand that some situations require a serious face and formal attitude but I also appreciate a workplace where people are encouraged to be themselves. I’m looking for a team that puts the team success over individual triumphs.

About me

I’m interested in architecture, urban planning, and cities in general. Being able to live in Amsterdam is a dream-come-true for me.

Travelling is one of my big passions and I always take my camera with me. It’s never done via travel agencies and I rarely sleep at one place more than a night or two. I happen to be a gifted driver of all sorts of vehicles but bike is the ultimate means of transport for me.

I enjoy cooking (and love eating) and I can appreciate a good craft milk stout or NEIPA. My sport of choice is basketball all year long and snowboard in the winter. The life doesn’t feel complete if I don’t come across some new and interesting band, movie or book at least once every week or so. I’m writing this text while our cat is purring on my lap.

Why it's a good idea to have me in your team

Typesetting guru

Be it corporate document or marketing brochure, I've done it all! During my days as a DTP-er I had plenty of opportunities to learn what layouts look good and how to fix the bad ones.

Man with the looks

Ever since university, I spent a lot of time with camera in my hand or editing pictures in front of my screen. Great way to fine-tune my sense for visual harmony!

Problem solver

When presented with a complex task I embrace the challenge, enjoying the path as much as achieving the goal itself.

Dedicated soul

It's important to me to be fully engaged in my job. I don't mind putting in the extra effort as long as it allows me to be trully proud of the final result.

True partner

Good team spirit is in my eyes one of the key features of a successful company and I strive within a sharing culture where my colleagues are also my friends.

  • Work Experience

  • Technical Support Engineer II | Optimizely

    May 2018 – present | Amsterdam NL

    Having a senior role within the Support team means that besides answering individual support tickets, my focus is on improving the overall team performance. I am a proactive team leader, I handle ticket escalations, introduce and/or revise internal processes and mentor new(er) colleagues.

    Highlights

    • I’m the dedicated TSE for three of the biggest EMEA customers;
    • I presented during Developer Night at Opticon 2018;
    • I have built GA via GTM integration 2.0 and I have also made improvements to the official Optimizely Chrome extension;
    • I have (re)defined the hiring process for the TSE role in EMEA including a brand new set of technical exercises;
    • I’m leading the Priority Support project and I’ve contributed to increasing the product revenue from $1.8M to $2.7M per annum.

  • Technical Support Engineer | Optimizely

    November 2016 – April 2018 | Amsterdam NL

    Main tasks included client-side troubleshooting of technical issues, customer enablement & training, analysis of data and integration discrepancies, liaising with product team about product bugs.


  • Front-end Web Developer | Codaisseur

    September 2016 – October 2016 | Amsterdam NL

    Helping the team with various tasks focused on frontend web development and graphic design. We ran RoR app & I commandeered HTML, CSS (Saas), Vanilla JavaScript and Adobe Creative Suite to get the job done.


  • Junior Front-end Web Developer | Ligo /Internship/

    August 2016 | Amsterdam NL

    As part of the training provided by Codaisseur, I spent three weeks working as a Frontend Developer in this small startup. I converted mockups into functional views in their RoR application and I also did a facelift, plus a few functional enhancements, of the company blog that ran on WordPress.


  • Accounting Administrator | TravelBird

    Feb 2016 - March 2016 | Amsterdam NL

    As a Financial Administrator I am responsible for ensuring correct booking invoices, raising and entering booking invoices into the general ledger and preparing timely payments to our suppliers and travellers. I maintain the financial administration and reconcile sales and purchase ledger accounts.


  • Freelance Photographer

    Jan 2016 - Present | Amsterdam NL

    Occasional freelance projects, mainly interior, architecture and event photography.


  • Project Manager | Overtaal (TransPerfect Family)

    Mar 2014 – Sep 2015 | Utrecht NL

    Overseeing a complete life cycle of translation projects, specializing in marketing and corporate documents. Besides ensuring successful execution of the assigned projects within the given budget and timeline, proactive communication with a high number of internal and external stakeholders was crucial to achieve maximum efficiency and quality.

    Given my experience with desktop publishing & typography, I took it upon myself to also assist with the training and development of the remote team of DTP operators.


  • DTP & Multimedia Specialist | Global DTP

    Jul 2011 – Dec 2013 | Brno CZ

    My main task was editing the layout and output control of translated documents and multimedia files, using specialized desktop publishing software, so they match technical and aesthetic criteria.


  • Junior Graphic Designer | Futuroom   /Internship/

    Jun 2010 – Sep 2010 | Prague CZ

    I was part of the team responsible for production of various print and web infographics, mainly for media houses. We were responsible for both selection of the topics and their graphical processing.
